Description: Fragments of an ear-ring and 11 beads in different shapes and materials. A: Three joining fragments of a penannular ear-ring, made of light turquoise glass, no finished end preserved. Roughly rounded in section. With inner groove similar to shell ear-rings. B: Six segmented cylindrical beads, three larger than the others with up to 10 segments preserved. All made of turquoise faience. C: One ring shaped bead, perforation off centre, made of turquoise faience. D: Two flattened spherical beads, one made of light green glass, the other of vivid turquoise faience. E: One disc-shaped bead made of turquoise faience. F: Fragment of a green to turquoise glass bead, possibly inlays of other material or other coloured glass, now lost.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
